tweet:
ICYMI – @USGAO has concluded the Trump administration broke the law by withholding Ukraine aid: 

“Faithful execution of the law does not permit the president to substitute his own policy priorities for those that Congress has enacted into law."

More ➡️ https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/16/us/politics/gao-trump-ukraine.html …

.@HouseDemocrats’ earthquake supplemental for Puerto Rico would provide immediate relief & support long-term recovery, with significant funding for educational needs, repairs to transportation infrastructure, & community development activities. ➡️  https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/house-democrats-release-puerto-rico-earthquake-supplemental … pic.twitter.com/BrxWM96tWp

Puerto Rico needs our help following devastating earthquakes. 

@HouseDemocrats have introduced emergency legislation that includes:

🏫 $100 million for educational needs
🛣️ $1.25 billion for road system repairs
🏗️ $2 billion for community development https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/house-democrats-release-puerto-rico-earthquake-supplemental …

.@HouseDemocrats’ $3.35 billion emergency supplemental for Puerto Rico earthquake relief provides robust funding for educational needs, transportation infrastructure repairs, and disaster relief activities. ➡️  https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/house-democrats-release-puerto-rico-earthquake-supplemental … pic.twitter.com/PqJKcFz44N

🚨 @AppropsDems Chairwoman @NitaLowey and @HouseDemocrats have released an emergency supplemental providing $3.35B to address devastating earthquake damage in Puerto Rico.

 https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/house-democrats-release-puerto-rico-earthquake-supplemental … pic.twitter.com/ZuICOwRwpq

More @NitaLowey: “While @SenateGOP face a choice in the upcoming trial on whether to be loyal to the President or to the Constitution, Congress must also take legislative action to ensure effective management of taxpayer dollars going forward.”

More @NitaLowey: “Given that this illegal conduct threatened our security and undermined our elections, I feel even more strongly that the House has chosen the right course by impeaching President Trump. No one is above the law.”

Chairwoman @NitaLowey on GAO’s determination: "The Trump Administration’s illegal impoundment of these vital national security funds was a brazen assault on the checks and balances inherent to our democracy." ➡️ https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/lowey-statement-on-gao-declaring-trump-s-ukraine-aid-withholding-illegal …

JUST IN: The nonpartisan Government Accountability Office has confirmed what Congressional Democrats have understood all along: President Trump abused his power and broke the law by withholding security assistance to Ukraine. pic.twitter.com/pCBI17QCCW

.@NitaLowey & @RepDavidEPrice on release of Puerto Rico aid: “It should never have come to this… We expect HUD will work collaboratively with Puerto Rico as they continue their recovery, & we will continue to provide robust oversight to ensure it does.”➡️  https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/lowey-price-statement-on-long-overdue-disaster-funding-for-puerto-rico … pic.twitter.com/UUVaXwtwB3

.@SpeakerPelosi is right: President Trump tried to use the appropriations process “as his private ATM machine” for personal & political gain. 

He should remember that the Constitution entrusts Congress, not the President, to make funding decisions. https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/11520-0 …

Republicans and Democrats alike are condemning President Trump’s plan to steal an additional $7.2 billion from our military to pay for his wasteful border wall.

More here ➡️ https://www.washingtonpost.com/immigration/lawmakers-from-both-parties-criticize-white-house-plan-to-take-72-billion-in-pentagon-funding-for-trumps-border-wall/2020/01/14/675838d4-36ed-11ea-bf30-ad313e4ec754_story.html …

With his latest wall theft, President Trump is once again putting a wasteful political stunt ahead of servicemembers and military families.

@NitaLowey, @RepVisclosky & @RepDWStweets: “He is choosing politics over their readiness and quality of life.” https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2020/01/14/us/politics/ap-us-border-wall-funding.html …
ICYMI -- Trump plot to 'steal' $7.2B for border wall puts GOP lawmakers in a pickle ⤵️ https://www.politico.com/news/2020/01/14/trump-border-wall-gop-pickle-098781 …

.@NitaLowey, @RepVisclosky & @RepDWSTweets on the Trump Administration's latest border wall theft: "This decision will make Americans less safe, burden more military families, and do further violence to the Constitutional separation of powers." 

More ➡️  https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/lowey-visclosky-and-wasserman-schultz-statement-on-trumps-latest-wall-theft … pic.twitter.com/Q5bnR8Qmvx

The FY 2020 spending agreement reflects @HouseDemocrats’ strong commitment to increase investments in science: 

⚡A $415 million increase for @ENERGY’s Office of Science
🌎A $233.2 million increase for @NASA Science
🔬A $203.3 million increase for @NSF pic.twitter.com/gBiehXkOyF

🌎@NOAA’s work over the past 50 years has been critical. 

That’s why @AppropsDems & @HouseDemocrats secured robust investments in NOAA in the FY 2020 spending agreement, including: 

⛈️$169.5 million for NOAA Climate Research
🌊$599 million for NOAA’s National Ocean Service https://twitter.com/NOAA/status/1216792758888910853 …

The FY 2020 spending agreement supports millions of U.S. veterans & their families through vital funding for veterans medical care - including funding for gender-specific care and mental health services - as a part of fully funding @DeptVetAffairs. pic.twitter.com/7xIkUmwjpM

With record-level funding for @NIH, the FY 2020 appropriations agreement bolsters groundbreaking medical research & maintains U.S. leadership in the pursuit of lifesaving cures & treatments. pic.twitter.com/YUa0suEneZ

.@HouseDemocrats fought hard to enact legislation that responsibly funds the government for FY 2020 & makes record-level investments in the Child Care & Development Block Grant & @HeadStartgov. pic.twitter.com/gBZLf13zaI

Opioids are a national epidemic, affecting lives in every community. @AppropsDems negotiated responsible FY 2020 spending bills that reflect our commitment to combating this crisis, with $1.5 billion in funding for State Opioid Response Grants. pic.twitter.com/G3cgFP2OcC

.@AppropsDems Transportation-HUD Subcommittee Chair @RepDavidEPrice on the Trump administration’s illegal withholding of Puerto Rico aid: “Good faith involves not just responding to this latest disaster, but cleaning up from the previous one as well.” https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2020/01/09/hit-by-devastating-earthquakes-puerto-rico-still-waiting-billions-hurricane-relief/ …

.@HouseDemocrats are fighting #ForThePeople & helping American families get ahead. The FY 2020 spending agreement increases funds for programs that expand access to affordable health care, better schools, & more good-paying jobs. pic.twitter.com/fVMvUvvbnv

🌐 Lack of access to broadband internet keeps rural communities from accessing key digital tools for education, health, & economic success.

The FY 2020 spending agreement invests millions in expanding rural broadband access. 📡 pic.twitter.com/vW1cR57687

Chair @BettyMcCollum04 & @AppropsDems Interior Subcommittee will hold public witness hearings on Feb. 6 for non-tribal programs, & Feb. 11 & 12 for tribal programs.
 
For instructions on submitting a request to testify or written testimony, click here ➡️ https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/interior-and-environment-subcommittee-announces-public-witness-hearing-dates-0 …

.@HouseDemocrats secured a spending agreement that responsibly funds the government for FY 2020 and invests in critical priorities like combating the climate crisis and boosting resiliency. ⤵️ pic.twitter.com/aTBfyq1w83

In the FY 2020 spending agreement, @AppropsDems & @HouseDemocrats fought hard to reject under-investment in environmental protection & instead provide resources to:

🚯 hold polluters accountable 
💧 ensure access to clean air & water
☣️ clean up toxic chemicals & hazardous waste pic.twitter.com/aLjV4qWjEu

The FY 2020 spending agreement upholds @HouseDemocrats’ commitment to economic growth & prosperity #ForThePeople, with investments of more than $61 billion in America’s infrastructure. pic.twitter.com/AVV0VDch2M

The FY 2020 spending agreement affirms @HouseDemocrats’ commitment to fight #ForThePeople by:

👪 Supporting children & families
🏫 Investing in better schools & job training
🔬 Bolstering lifesaving medical research

Learn more about the agreement here: https://appropriations.house.gov/news/fact-sheets/critical-victories-for-democratic-priorities-in-fiscal-year-2020-appropriations …

.@AppropsDems & @HouseDemocrats worked hard to enact FY 2020 spending bills that:

🗳️ Provide election security grants to states
🥼 Fund gun violence research
🏘️ Fully fund a fair & accurate 2020 Census

With FY 2021 around the corner, we’ll continue fighting #ForThePeople.
